Room.Name: Path to Dwarven Village
Room.Description: All around you are the mountains of the southern range, home of dwarves and giants. You can climb back down the mountains to the west and leave these realms, or seek riches in the northern mineshafts. A dirt road leads south, towards a small building. You can hear crying and shrieking coming from it.

Exit.Description: A rocky road leads back to Midgaard and the mines of Moria.

Room.Name: Path, base of mountain
Room.Description: Now you are at the bottom of a rugged mountain. The forest around you is very dense, and it seems very dark to the north.

Exit.Description: The path continues up the mountain.
The path heads toward the main city.

Room.Name: Path, middle of mountain
Room.Description: Standing on the middle of the mountain, you can easily see the turning point to the south, and the top of the mountain is very near to the north.

Exit.Description: The top of the mountain is easily seen from here.
The base of the mountain is near.

Room.Name: Top of mountain
Room.Description: You are now on the top of the mountain. To the south you see a path leading down the mountain. To the east and west you see entrances to what seems like mines.

Exit.Description: An entrance to the mountain which seems to lead underground.
The path leads down the mountain to the main city.
There is an entrance to the mountain.

Room.Name: Narrow Path
Room.Description: This is a narrow path leading to the Dwarven Kingdom. It looks less travelled than the others, and it is very creepy. The path opens up to the south, and continues to the north.

Room.Name: Entrance to Mountain
Room.Description: Here is an entrance to the mountain. The door looks very well built, and you can hear noise coming from within.

Room.Name: Bend in Narrow Path
Room.Description: This is a narrow path that bends to the east here. The trees hang over the path, and it is very overgrown. The narrow path continues to the south and to the east.

ExtraDescription.Description: They hang over the road in the most ominous of ways.

Room.Name: Narrow path
Room.Description: This path is very narrow, and it continues to the north and west.

Room.Name: Narrow north-south path
Room.Description: This path leads to the north and south. To the north you can see a door, and to the south the path continues.

Room.Name: Door to Kingdom
Room.Description: Here the path turns to the west. You can see a door in front of you, and the path continues to the west and south.

Room.Name: Path to the Castle
Room.Description: You are on a path that will eventually lead to the castle. It continues north to the castle, and there is a door on the western wall.

Room.Name: Still on the path to the Castle
Room.Description: You are still on the path to the castle, or back to the Dwarven village, whichever way you wish to go. The path continues to the north and south.

Room.Name: Door to Castle
Room.Description: Here there is a door to the castle to the east. The castle is elegantly designed, and looks much like a roll of toilet paper standing on end. A sign says: ****************************************** * WELCOME TO THE CASTLE OF STRANGELOVE * * Here, celibacy is uninvited * ******************************************

Room.Name: Inside the entrance
Room.Description: Everything here is covered in soot and very grimy. The path continues to the east and north, and there is a door to the west.

Exit.Description: The little underground path continues to the north.
The path leads outside the entrance.
This looks like an entrance to some type of store room.

Room.Name: Path
Room.Description: You are on a path in the dwarven village which leads north to the shops and south to the corner of the area.

Room.Name: Turn in road
Room.Description: You are on a path that leads to a Hide & Tooth shop to the west, and the path continues to the south.

Exit.Description: The Hide & Tooth shop is seen to the west.

Room.Name: Hide & Tooth Shop
Room.Description: You are in the Hide & Tooth shop. Here you may buy the finest in Dwarven weapons and armors. The path continues to the north and east.

Room.Name: Path to the north of shop
Room.Description: You are on a path to the north of the Hide & Tooth shop. The path continues to the north, and there is Granite Head's bakery to the west.

Room.Name: North of Shops
Room.Description: Here the path bends to the east towards the barracks. To the south you can see the shops.

Room.Name: Path by Hospital
Room.Description: Here the path passes by the Hospital to the north. It continues to the east to the barracks, and to the west.

Room.Name: Path next to barracks
Room.Description: Here the path continues west, and east to the barracks.

Room.Name: Entrance to barracks
Room.Description: Here there is an entrance to the barracks to the south, and the path continues to the west.

Room.Name: Guard House
Room.Description: You are in the guard house to the west of the entrance to the castle. There are nude posters covering the walls.

ExtraDescription.Description: There is a wall poster of a nude Minne Pearl.

Room.Name: First Barrack room
Room.Description: Here is the first of two main rooms of barracks. The barracks continue to the south, and you can leave the room to the north.

Room.Name: Back of Barracks
Room.Description: Here is the back of the dwarven barracks. There are rows of beds here, and there is a stench that is unbearable.

Room.Name: Inside of Castle Strangelove
Room.Description: You are just inside the castle. It is very tubular in shape, and it is very featureless. There is a set of stairs that lead up, and the door leads out of the castle to the west.

Room.Name: A store room
Room.Description: There is a layer of dust on the floor at least 3 inches thick! It is probable that not many people have been in here for many months.

Exit.Description: A lighted area that looks like a well worn path.

ExtraDescription.Description: After blowing all the dust off the floor, you notice a trapdoor!

Room.Name: Wine cellar
Room.Description: This room smells like wine, and you can only assume it used to be a wine cellar at one time.

Room.Name: Stairs in castle
Room.Description: The stairs continue to circle up and down here.

Room.Name: Stairs
Room.Description: You are still circling around on the stairs. You are starting to get dizzy from going around and around and around and around and around. The stairs continue up and down.

Room.Name: Top of stairs
Room.Description: You are at the top of the stairs in the castle. There is an exit to the east, and the stairs lead down.

Room.Name: Queen's waiting room
Room.Description: This is the Queen's waiting room. Here the men literally 'wait' for the queen. You've heard that the queen really likes to get to 'know' her people, in the biblical sense. The queen's bedroom is to the north, and you can see stairs to the west.

Room.Name: Bedroom
Room.Description: This is the Queen's bedroom. The bed is all ruffled, and there is a stack of dirty sheets piled in the corner. A note has been scrawled in lipstick on the mirror: I'm out looking for my birth control pills. Why don't you slip into something comfortable while you're waiting?

Room.Name: Hospital
Room.Description: You are inside the Dwarven Hospital. It smells like rubbing alcohol, and there is blood all over the walls.

Room.Name: Granite Head's Bakery
Room.Description: The aroma coming from this room is sensuous. You can almost taste the pastries dissolving in your mouth.

Room.Name: Dark path
Room.Description: This path is very well worn, and there is an entrance to the mines to the east, while the path continues to the north and west.

Room.Name: Mine entrance
Room.Description: The little path here leads down toward the mines, while the worn path continues to the west.

Room.Name: Inside the mine
Room.Description: There are holes everywhere from the places that the workers blew away the rock to get to whatever they were looking for. A path leads down and up.

Room.Name: Path in the mine
Room.Description: You are deep inside the mine, and you feel very uncomfortable. The path continues to the east, and leads to the mineshaft to the west.

Room.Name: Mine crossroad
Room.Description: You are at a crossroad in the mine. There is a door to the north, and the path continues to the south, east, and west.

Room.Name: Coal Room
Room.Description: You are inside the storage area for the raw materials that are found down here. The room is very unsturdy as the supports are very rickety.

Room.Name: Mine Maze
Room.Description: You have entered the maze of the mines. To the east you can see some inscriptions, and you can exit to the south.

Room.Name: Maze inscription
Room.Description: You are inside the maze, but not far enough in that you could get lost.

Room.Name: Maze
Room.Description: You are in a maze.

Room.Name: Maze
Room.Description: You are in a maze.

Room.Name: Maze
Room.Description: You are in a maze.

Room.Name: Mining equipment room
Room.Description: This is the storage room for equipment used by the Dwarven miners. It is very small, and you can tell that not many miners actually use any equipment.

Room.Name: Solved the Maze.
Room.Description: You have solved the maze. You can tell by the last few moves that there is no way that a dumb worker could have figured that out. It seems pretty desolate here. To the south is a bleak room. To the north, you see the maze. There is a sign above the south exit: Those who enter, plan on a timely death. Especially if you're loyal to the queen.

Room.Name: The Mazekeeper's Room
Room.Description: You have entered the Mazekeeper's room. There are pictures of the Queen with darts thrown in it. Spray-painted on the wall are things like 'the queen shall suffer' and 'Catholics Rule'.

Room.Name: Bottom of mineshaft
Room.Description: You are at the bottom of the mineshaft. The air here is very sooty, and it is very hard to breath. The mineshaft leads up and east.

Room.Name: The mountains of the dwarven kingdom
Room.Description: You are standing at the foot of the mountains of the dwarven kingdom, where dwarves and giants toil endlessly to pry gems and mithril from the mother earth. Here lies the palace of the dwarven queen, and untold riches. But beware, for the mines are said to be haunted by demon and spirit alike. The dwarven kingdom lies to the east.

NPC.name: dwarf guard
NPC.description: The guard looks very tough and mean.

NPC.name: dwarf worker miner
NPC.description: He is very dirty, and looks extremely over-worked.
NPC.longDescription: A dwarven mining worker is here.

NPC.name: wraith
NPC.longDescription: A wraith is awaiting your first move here.

NPC.name: storekeeper
NPC.description: The storekeeper is very rotund, but looks like a sharp guy.
NPC.longDescription: There is the Hide & Tooth storekeeper standing here, waiting patiently.

NPC.name: baker
NPC.description: Granite Head is covered with flour and grains.
NPC.longDescription: Granite Head, the baker, is waiting for a customer here.

NPC.name: lizard
NPC.description: This scaly creature looks like it is well adapted to it's underground habitat. He looks very powerful.

NPC.name: giant
NPC.description: The giant is about 8 feet tall, with arms of steel, and looks very strong.

NPC.name: dwarf miner
NPC.description: The mineworker is very tired, and very dirty, and he has bulging muscles.

NPC.name: dwarf leader
NPC.description: The mine leader is very big and very strong.
NPC.longDescription: A dwarven mine leader is here.

NPC.name: dwarf doctor
NPC.description: He is a very skilled surgeon, with hands of steel.

NPC.name: dwarf peon
NPC.longDescription: A dwarven peon is awaiting help here.

NPC.name: dwarf son
NPC.longDescription: An unwanted son is here. You feel sorry for the guy.

NPC.name: dwarf daughter
NPC.longDescription: An unwanted daughter is here. You feel sorry for her.

NPC.name: man
NPC.longDescription: A man in waiting is here. He looks nervous and unsure of himself.

NPC.name: snake
NPC.longDescription: There is a giant snake here.

Item.Name: key green
Item.LongDescription: A deep green key is on the floor.

Item.Name: dwarven hammer
Item.LongDescription: There is a dwarven hammer laying here.

Item.Name: dwarven plate
Item.LongDescription: There is dwarven plate mail laying here.

Item.Name: stick
Item.LongDescription: There is a long, black stick lying here.

Item.Name: stick
Item.LongDescription: There is a long, black stick here.

Item.Name: club
Item.LongDescription: There is a dwarven club laying here.

Item.Name: two-handed dwarven axe
Item.LongDescription: A two-handed Dwarven axe is here.

Item.Name: ring golden dwarven
Item.LongDescription: A pretty golden ring is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It seems to be a hot love letter from the Queen. Unfortunately, it's not suitable for transmission across a public data network.

Item.Name: castle key
Item.LongDescription: There is a key to Strangelove Castle here.

Item.Name: key mine
Item.LongDescription: There is a key to the mines here.

Item.Name: coal
Item.LongDescription: There is a chunk of coal here.

Item.Name: pick
Item.LongDescription: There is a mining pick here.

Item.Name: pills
Item.ShortDescription: a box of birth control pills
Item.LongDescription: There is a box of birth control pills here.

ExtraDescription.Description: They are in a circular container, and there are numbers corresponding to the day that they are to be taken. You can tell they haven't been used for a while.

Item.Name: map castle strangelove
Item.LongDescription: A rolled up map is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: . * * * Castle Strangelove * * * __________ = = ==================== = = \ Queen's \ \ Bedroom \ \_________\ * __________ ____\_____ North Up \ Top of \ \ Waiting \ \ | \ Stairs \----\ Room \ \ | \_________\ \_________\ West ---- + ---- East | | \ _____|____ | \ \ \ Down South \ Stairs \ [] - You need the Castle Key \_________\ to get beyond this point. | The Castle Key can be _____|____ found on the Grinning \ \ Dwarves in the Barracks. \ Stairs \ \_________\ * - You need the Deep Green | Key to get beyond this __________ _____|____ point. This key can be \ Door to \ \ Inside \ found on the Wraith in \ Castle \-[]-\ Castle \ the wine cellar or on one \_________\ \_________\ of the Dwarven Guards on \ the Dark path. ____\_____ \ Path to \ \ Castle \ \_________\ \ __________ ____\_____ \ Door to \ \ Path to \ \ Kingdom \----\ Castle \ \_________\ \_________\ \ To Dwarven Kingdom
